subject: Re: [PATCH v4 03/25] io_uring/kbuf: add support for kernel-managed buffer rings

reviews.author: Joanne Koong (author)
reviews.summary: The reviewer, Joanne Koong (author), clarified that the patch for kernel-managed buffer rings is separate from zero-copying and only used for non-zero-copyable payloads to minimize memory footprint.

reviews.author: Caleb Mateos
reviews.summary: Caleb Mateos pointed out a logical inconsistency in the io_uring implementation, specifically how the fixed index get and put functions interact.

reviews.author: Bernd Schubert
reviews.summary: Bernd Schubert reviewed several patches in the series, providing mostly minor feedback and suggestions for improvement. He requested a sanity check in fuse_copy_do() to ensure cs->len is > 0 when cs->is_kaddr is true.

reviews.author: Bernd Schubert
reviews.summary: The reviewer raised concerns about initialization of cs->len in fuse_copy_fill and pointed out an inconsistency in the code for recycling kernel-managed buffer rings.

reviews.author: Christoph Hellwig
reviews.summary: Christoph Hellwig suggested splitting the patch series into smaller ones for easier review, requested documentation for the uapi, and provided several technical comments on specific patches.

reviews.author: Askar Safin
reviews.summary: The reviewer questioned whether kernel-managed buffer rings (kbufs) solve the same problem as splice, and referenced a quote from Linus Torvalds to support their concern.
